data.title: ask for trouble
data.text:
English

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

ask for trouble (third-person singular simple present asks for trouble, present participle asking for trouble, simple past and past participle asked for trouble)

To behave in a way that is likely to cause problems.

ask for it, look for trouble

Usage notes

[edit]

Chiefly used in the present continuous: be asking for trouble.

Translations

[edit]

ask for it — see ask for it

References

[edit]

“be asking for trouble”, in Cambridge English Dictionary, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire: Cambridge University Press, 1999–present.

“be asking for trouble” in Longman Dictionary of Contemporary English, Longman.

“be asking for trouble”, in Collins English Dictionary.
